docs.snippet: HEYMAN--Lisa, age 47. Oscar Heyman & Brothers mourns the passing of our dear Lisa Heyman on February 25. Lisa will always be remembered as the devoted mother of Roxanne and Ruby, the cherished wife of Larry Gauchman, the beloved daughter of Barbar...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEYMAN--Lisa, age 47. Oscar Heyman & Brothers mourns the passing of our dear Lisa Heyman on February 25. Lisa will always be remembered as the devoted mother of Roxanne and Ruby, the cherished wife of Larry Gauchman, the beloved daughter of Barbara and Marvin, and the loving sister of Jonathan, Ben, and Ruth. We will always remember Lisa's warmth, humor, charm, and especially her devotion to family. Service at King David Cemetery, 101 Mill Street, Putnam Valley, NY, 11am, Wednesday, February 27. Donations to The Amyloidosis Foundation, 7151 North Main Street, Suite 208, Clarkston, Michigan, 48346. Shiva at the home of her husband, Larry, after the service until 7pm, Thursday 3-8pm, Saturday 6-8 pm, and on Sunday, at the home of her mother, Barbara, 3-8pm.

docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (Sundance) THE DEATH OF MR. LAZARESCU (2005) A cranky, ailing man (Ion Fiscuteanu, above) slowly dies as he is moved through a series of hospitals where doctors deny him treatment, accompanied only by a steadfast nurse (Luminita Gheorghiu) ...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (Sundance) THE DEATH OF MR. LAZARESCU (2005) A cranky, ailing man (Ion Fiscuteanu, above) slowly dies as he is moved through a series of hospitals where doctors deny him treatment, accompanied only by a steadfast nurse (Luminita Gheorghiu) who refuses to leave his side. This Romanian masterpiece, directed by Cristi Puiu, ''explores the intersection of the social and the personal on the human body,'' Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. ''Over the course of the torturous, inept hospitalization that eventually realizes the threat of the film's title, Mr. Lazarescu's body becomes a field of meaning.'' 8 P.M. (TCM) THE DAY OF THE JACKAL (1973) Turner Classic Movies continues its Oscar tribute with a salute to the 70s, starting with this espionage thriller by Fred Zinnemann, adapted from the novel by Frederick Forsyth, about a British hit man (Edward Fox) -- code name the Jackal -- who agrees to kill Charles de Gaulle, the president of France, for half a million dollars. At 10:30 ''Three Days of the Condor'' (1973), starring Robert Redford as a C.I.A. researcher who uncovers top secret information and finds himself marked for death; at 12:30 a.m. ''Marathon Man'' (1976), with Dustin Hoffman as a graduate student who unwittingly finds himself involved in a mysterious plot involving diamonds and a Nazi war criminal (Laurence Olivier); and at 2:45 ''The Boys from Brazil'' (1978), this time with Olivier playing a veteran Nazi hunter and Steve Guttenberg as his green sidekick, who stumble upon a plan to regenerate the SS in Paraguay. Gregory Peck plays Dr. Josef Mengele.

docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (21) THE FOUR-WINGED DINOSAUR In 2002 scientists discovered a superbly preserved fossil that reopened the debate over the origin of flight. With four wings, including one on each leg, and intricate feathers, the crow-sized creature  --  cal...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (21) THE FOUR-WINGED DINOSAUR In 2002 scientists discovered a superbly preserved fossil that reopened the debate over the origin of flight. With four wings, including one on each leg, and intricate feathers, the crow-sized creature -- called Microraptor -- was one of the smallest dinosaurs ever found and like nothing paleontologists had seen. This ''Nova'' episode travels to the Chinese stone quarry where the fossil was discovered and follows experts in paleontology, biomechanics, aerodynamics, animation and scientific reconstruction as they put a replica of the fossil through a test flight in a wind tunnel and debate the evolution of flight in birds. 8 P.M. (BBC America) RAMSAY'S KITCHEN NIGHTMARES Gordon Ramsay takes on his biggest project to date with an overhaul of the 200-seat Granary, which, after a recent $4 million rehab, is still losing $8,000 a week. The locals in rural Hampshire think the modern British cuisine is too fussy. It's Mr. Ramsay's job to bring the restaurant back down to earth.

docs.snippet: Like ''Atonement,'' for which Sarah Greenwood, right, the production designer, earned an Oscar nomination, ''Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day,'' her latest effort, is a terrific wallpaper movie. The 30s farce features Frances McDormand as an English...
docs.lead_paragraph: Like ''Atonement,'' for which Sarah Greenwood, right, the production designer, earned an Oscar nomination, ''Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day,'' her latest effort, is a terrific wallpaper movie. The 30s farce features Frances McDormand as an English governess down on her luck, but the real star is the set, far right. Q.Most of the film takes place in the fantastical flat of Delysia Lafosse, an American nightclub singer on the make. What was your inspiration?
docs.abstract: Sarah Greenwood, production designer, comments on wallpaper in her latest movie, Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day; photo (Currents column) (S)

headline.main: Just Let the Wallpaper Do the Acting

docs.snippet: From the moment Hank Steinbrenner commandeered Jonathan Mahler’s rental car, navigated it through Tampa then swerved onto a walkway at Legends Field and pulled to stop a few feet from his offices, Mahler could sense something “very Steinbrenna...
docs.lead_paragraph: From the moment Hank Steinbrenner commandeered Jonathan Mahler’s rental car, navigated it through Tampa then swerved onto a walkway at Legends Field and pulled to stop a few feet from his offices, Mahler could sense something “very Steinbrennarian” about the older son who was taking command of the New York Yankees, along with his brother Hal. “Hank was in exile for so many years,” Mahler said the other day, “but he’s clearly quite comfortable stepping into this role.”.
